page.title: 15St Oswald's Church.Ashbourne
page.content: {St Oswalds church}is on the west side of Ashbourne.It was built in 1241 and has a tall spire of 64 metres with a cock on the top.In the churchyard in spring there are thousands of daffodils.By the west door there is a statue of St Oswald.Round the walls are many buttresses and gargoyles. Inside the church are many stained glass windows.One of these shows two girls who died when their clothes caught fire.The white marble tomb of Lady Penelope aged 6 can be seen in the side chapel.
